sentences.en: "Gentlemen, I bid you adieu."
sentences.cn: “先生们，告辞了。”

sentences.en: A German firm launched a takeover bid for the company.
sentences.cn: 一家德国公司试图收购这家公司.

sentences.en: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.cn: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.en: a takeover bid for the company
sentences.cn: 出价收购这家公司

sentences.en: bid up the price of wheat.
sentences.cn: 哄抬小麦价格

sentences.en: Hanson made an agreed takeover bid of £351 million.
sentences.cn: 汉森按协商出价3.51亿英镑接管该公司。

sentences.en: He certainly wasn't going to bid $18 billion for this company.
sentences.cn: 他肯定不会出180亿美元来收购这家公司。

sentences.en: He has submitted a bid to resuscitate the struggling magazine.
sentences.cn: 他已经投标来拯救这个岌岌可危的周刊。

sentences.en: He made a bid for freedom by climbing over the wall.
sentences.cn: 他企图翻越这面高墙以获得自由.

sentences.en: I bid you adieu.
sentences.cn: 跟你说再见。

sentences.en: Kingfisher launched a hostile bid for Dixons.
sentences.cn: 翠丰集团对迪克森公司展开了恶意竞购。

sentences.en: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.cn: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.en: She wanted to bid for it.
sentences.cn: 她想出价买下它。

sentences.en: Speculation centred on a likely bid price of 380p a share.
sentences.cn: 大多数人猜测买方出价可能为每股380便士。

sentences.en: The bank announced its intention to bid.
sentences.cn: 这家银行宣布了参加竞标的意向。

sentences.en: The blizzard forced them to delay their summit bid.
sentences.cn: 暴风雪迫使他们推迟登顶.

sentences.en: the girl bade fair to be pretty.
sentences.cn: 那姑娘好像很漂亮。

sentences.en: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.cn: 出价最高的人

sentences.en: The queen bade us enter.
sentences.cn: 女王吩咐我们进去。

sentences.en: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.cn: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

sentences.en: They agreed to bid the picture up to 4,500 francs.
sentences.cn: 他们同意将这幅画的价格提至4,500法郎。

sentences.en: They have claimed some impressive scalps in their bid for the championship.
sentences.cn: 他们已在夺取冠军的征途上获得显著进展。

sentences.en: Three firms bid for the contract on the new buildings.
sentences.cn: 有三家公司竞标承包新楼工程。

sentences.en: Tonight they take on a Chinese pairing in their bid to reach the final tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 今晚他们将挑战一对中国选手，争取进入明天的决赛。

sentences.en: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.cn: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

phrases.tran_cn: 标书；招标文件；投标资料
评标；报价评审，标书评审
(古 或 诗／文)好像有可能
出高价：在拍卖中为自己的财产定出高价以抬高最终售价
收购行动；收购竞争；购并出价

trans.tran_en: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction

trans.tran_cn: 努力争取，投标，出价，（游戏中）叫牌，问候，道别，吩咐
trans.tran_en: to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an  auction
an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an  auction

trans.tran_cn: 出， 喊； 祝， 表示； 命令， 吩咐
trans.tran_en: to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an  auction
